results.title: Dax's Case
results.brief_description: This documentary raised vital questions about a patient’s right to choose whether to live or die, and about the role of the medical and legal profession. In 1973 Dax Cowart, a former air force pilot, was the victim of an explosion which left him blind, disfigured and suffering excruciating pain from severe burns. Despite persistent pleas to be allowed to die, Dax was kept alive. Now, leading a full life, he still maintains that he should have been allowed to die.

results.title: Darwin was right!
results.brief_description: Fun and games with the animals at the Goologul Gardens including seals, bears and monkeys. Focusses mainly on chimpanzees with footage of them at various “human” activities - playing drums, fiddling with a hand-cranked camera, bathing a baby etc.

results.title: Danish porcelain
results.creator_credit: Gunnar Robert Hansen and Dansk Kulturfilm
results.brief_description: After tracing the history of porcelain from ancient China, shows all stages of production in the Royal Danish Porcelain Factory, and in the Bing and Grondahl Factory. Shows specimens of modern Danish ceramic art.

results.title: Danger level
results.creator_credit: Warren J Mills, Ansvar Insurance and Christopher Productions
results.brief_description: Tests of the effects of alcohol consumption on driving performance carried out by the Univeristy of New South Wales at the Warwick Farm Motor Racing Circuit. Volunteers including leading professional drivers undertake tests of skill after dosage to various blood alcohol levels, showing how ability is impaired.

results.title: Dandy dust (E)
results.brief_description: This genre-defying, gender-bending, no-budget, experimental feature draws its inspiration from such diverse sources as cyberpunk, anime, splatter films, sci-fi, Hong Kong action flicks, feminist theory, and queer underground cinema. Dandy is a “cyborg techno-human of fluid gender” who participates in a series of surreal, fetishistic sexual encounters whilst travelling across time and space in a bizzare futuristic universe. Extreme, visceral and visually inventive, the film gleefully upturns conventional notions of narrative, sex, gender and family, in its irreverent exploration of the relationship between body and machine, and the interplay between violence, eroticism and ritual. Cast includes Tre Temperilli, Hans Schierl and Svar Simpson.

results.title: Dance trip
results.brief_description: Describes the immigration of Filipinos to Hawaii and their lives, history and accomplishments there; recounts Philippine-United States relationships through old film clips. Presents many Filipino folk dances as danced by the Bailes de Jose.

results.title: Dance of the shells = Tanz der muscheln
results.brief_description: The many shaped and many textured world of shells from all over the oceans is observed under changing lights and in varied patterns of movement. The accompanying music is composed of electronically produced sound. Beautifully photographed and dramatically lit - a very striking film.
